title: Simulation-Based Direct Instruction Program for Improving Reading and Mathematics Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary education curricula and at least three years of practical experience
context.additional_context: Instructional competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers; VR-based training for elementary educators to improve reading and math instructional skills by applying teaching methods in simulated environments; learners engage via personal devices and demonstrate outcomes through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five-step procedure of direct instruction (introduction, presentation, guided practice, independent practice, evaluation) in a simulation environment with 90% accuracy.

When designing VR-based reading activities, learners can implement three core strategies (clear modeling, systematic feedback, gradual learning stages) according to the "error-free communication" principle.
When teaching math concepts, learners can analyze learner error patterns with 80% accuracy and develop customized simulation instructional materials reflecting these patterns.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
